wikipedia_page.main: Albert Arthur Jones (23 October 1915 – 6 December 1991) was a British Conservative Party politician.  He was twice Mayor of Bedford.

response: *19 July 1972 – An amendment, moved by Conservative backbencher Arthur Jones, to the Local Government Bill, which sought to give new district councils the power to control refuse disposal, was passed with the support of opposition parties by 190–186.
